result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M Brody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Firearm-Contrary to Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Brody to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp."
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Susbstance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: -- to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $100 drug testing fee
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per the Agent

--to undergo AODA and follow through with recommended treatment per the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening, to occur at least once per month for the first six months after release from incarceration

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

The Court orders that the Ruger 9mmSR9 Semi-automatic handgun, Serial No 33008920 is forfeited and it shall be disposed of pursuant to Statute 968.20.

6/6/16: The Court hereby Orders that the Judgment of Conviction shall be amended to remove the language regarding forfeiture and destruction of the Ruger 9mmSR9 Semi-automatic handgun, Serial No. 33008920, as this gun was reported stolen by an innocent owner, Stephen Moller, who has requested the return of the weapon.

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per the Agent

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.



Consecutive to: This sentence is consecutive to the sentence in Count #1.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 4:18pm. 
Defendant Eric M Brody in court with Attorney Sylvie H Dahnert.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.    
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding victim rights compliance, ADA Shock indicates that there is no statutory victim involved. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Brody makes a statement.

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Brody to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
On Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Brody to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to the sentence in Count #1.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 2 days credit for time already served is granted only as to Count #1.

On both cases the Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision as set forth on the Criminal Case Settlement form which are:
--to undergo AODA and follow through with recommended treatment per the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening, to occur at least once per month for the first six months after release from incarceration
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per the Agent 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--on Count #1:  to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $100 drug testing fee 
--on Count #3:  to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

The Court orders that the Ruger 9mmSR9 Semi-automatic handgun, Serial No 33008920 is forfeited and it shall be disposed of pursuant to Statute 968.20.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 4:52pm
Sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 10:14 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Motion Hearing)
Defendant Eric M Brody in court with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Dahnert files plea paperwork & informs the Court that they would like to enter a plea today and set matter out for sentencing on the currently scheduled FSSC date, presents basis
DA Happ files amended information; No objection from Defense - DA Happ presents basis for amendment of information
Court grants State leave to file amended information. Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #3 of amended information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #4 of amended information
off-record for scheduling: 10:36 - 10:41 am
Court reviews with Mr. Brody that he understands that the Court is not bound by the State's offer
off-record: 10:41 - 10:41 am
Clerk announces date for the record
Recess: 10:42 am

Case called at 3:16pm [mo]
Defendant Eric M Brody in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Brody waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the State motions to amend the charging language in Count #3 to be contrary to statute 813.12
--the Court does amend the Information by its own hand, striking (1)(f) and inserting Wis. Stat. 813.12
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling

Case called at 1:24 pm [sf]
Defendant Eric M Brody in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD appears for bond purposed only). ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-No possesion of any dangerous weapons as defined by statute
-No possession of any ammunition
-No contact with Justine Lagoo or Jennifer Showtice

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:32 pm
